text: [Music]
[Applause]
[Music]
hello I'm fauricio a technical account
manager here at the AWS office in San
Jose Costa Rica today I'm going to show
you how to resolve the unable to verify
or create output bucket error in Amazon
Athena let's get started after logging
into the AWS Management console navigate
to the Athena console
click on explore the query editor select
settings
confirm that you have a bucket listed in
the query results location if you
manually set the query result location
confirm that the Amazon simple storage
service bucket exists by navigating to
the S3 console in the relevant account
search for the S3 bucket
if the bucket exists then check the AWS
identity and access management policy
for the user or role that runs the query
navigate to the identity and access
Management console
go to the users or roles section
depending on your use case
select the user or role used to run the
queries
then confirm that the permission shown
in the following example policy are
allowed by reviewing the attached
policies
also make sure that the IEM policy does
not contain a deny statement that uses
the IP or VPC ID to restrict access to
the S3 bucket you can also use this
example policy to provide access to the
user or role
it's important to note that in the
resource section the AWS Athena query
results is required only if you are
using the default query results location
so now you know how to give users access
to resolve the unable to verify create
output bucket error in Amazon Athena
thanks for watching and happy cloud
computing from all of us here at AWS
[Applause]
[Music]
[Music]
